attributes.action: Free swimming concessions for elderly on a national basis.
attributes.background: To increase health and activity of older population at all public pools . Older people have limited income so free swimming would encourage healthier lifestyle.  Pools are paid out of council tax so should benifit local elderly .

attributes.action: Introduce a 3 strike policy before benefits can be sanctioned.
attributes.background: The use of automatic benefit sanctions is littered with examples of hardship incurred to those being sanctioned. There is no evidence that automatic benefit sanctions "help" people into work. It takes time to find a job, however anybody can have an emergency which causes them to miss an appointment.
attributes.additional_details:
http://tfne.ws/1him6Lp - "Half of all DWP sanctions wrongly imposed"
http://bit.ly/1Yex8Tr - "Warning vulnerable families are being pushed into poverty by wrongly imposed benefit sanctions"
http://bit.ly/1TYFXki - "A list of completely ridiculous benefit sanctions people have experienced"

attributes.action: Force childcare providers to cap escalating and over priced childcare costs
attributes.background: Since my son has been in private nursery, we have paid £14000. My son has been in nursery for 13 months! Over the course of two years, we would have paid £25000 which is enough for a deposit on a house. This is obscene and believe that childcare should be capped to no more than £45 per day.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do parents have to pay for bank holidays but also for family holidays making it near impossible to go on holiday for some families. Many parents earn nothing after paying childcare fees but yet we are urged to work. With some childcare providers charging in excess of £90 per day, how are we supposed to pay these costs?

attributes.action: Publish all UK accounts in regard to EU & the Commons debate & scrutinise them.
attributes.background:
To make an informed decision at the referendum
I need to see with immediate effect all the UK accounts & contractual documents in regard to the EEC/EU
This will include all monies etc going to or from the EU
AND
all monies etc given out in the UK listing exactly without exception all recipients.
attributes.additional_details:
The complete accounts & documents to be openly published on the Government website.
The EU have failed to openly publish their accounts for over 18 years
& report said money is lost in corruption.
I am sick of hearing both sides referring to reports that are not always independent.
A full open audit will expose the truth & facts.

Without this evidence
As with any contract unless I can read & consider the terms & conditions then I will refuse to sign it.
In this case I will Vote to Leave the EU.

attributes.action: Create a separate loan that caters for accommodation for university students
attributes.background: Many student loans barely cover the cost of accommodation, so how will students from low income families go to the university of their choice when accommodation is more than the loan they are entitled to? This leaves many students in a deficit before they've even paid for anything.
attributes.additional_details: With an extra loan that caters for accommodation students will not have debt on their shoulders as soon as they start university, and can start focusing on more important things like the education itself. If grants are scrapped, at least bring something new and realistic to the table? This way less students will be tied between going to university or not because of the expenses, and will have easier access to a higher education letting students from 'low income families' have a better chance.

attributes.action: Stop allowing supermarkets to sell cheap alcohol.
attributes.background: The Pub Trade is dying, supermarkets are allowed to sell cheap alcohol which allows people to drink to excess and cause more stress on the NHS Police and other emergency services.  pubs are not allowed to do this by law.
attributes.additional_details:
All the major supermarkets are allowed to do the promotions i.e selling a litre of Vodka for aprox £15.
This stops people visiting bars and keeping them alive, pubs are being turned into shops and the community is losing out with having no where to go to celebrate birthdays etc.
We need to act now and save our pub's and clubs from disappearing .

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to ignore the "No Junk Mail" and "No Callers" Door signs
attributes.background: The "Junk Mail" and "No Callers"  signs are placed on doors by residents in an attempt to stop the need to deal with this menace. But because there is no legal requirement, the wishes of these residents are ignored, and the rights of the residents to not be harassed in their own home are violated.
attributes.additional_details: This type of law is already in place in countries like Australia, and USA

attributes.action: Replace extortionate fees (24%) charged to parents by CMS with standard fee.
attributes.background: Paying parent pays 20% - receiving parent pays 4% to CMS for setting up direct debit.  Fees are disproportionate to the effort required by CMS to effect payment.  Fees are significantly more than fees charged to make simple bank transfer or BACS payment, regardless of the amount involved.
attributes.additional_details: The 24% charge is a standard charge, whether payment is £1 or £1000.  This fee amounts to a lot for some paying parents and represents money that could be better spent on the children.  The CMS should at least explain the reasons for this extortionate fee level, and be transparent about what they actually do to deserve such a fee.  Monies already paid by parents should receive a refund along the lines of the PPI scandal.  (Will give CMS something to do!)

attributes.action: Stop taxing and means testing veterans service pensions
attributes.background: Veterans are not benefing from their service pensions due to taxation and means testing .

attributes.action: Exemption of the 3% tax levy on parents helping their children to buy a home.
attributes.background: Helping children to buy homes should not be taxed. The money being used by parents has already been taxed twice as salary and as savings. This law is morally corrupt.

attributes.action: Disband the polices current internal complaints investigation Service & the IPCC
attributes.background:
Two years ago the government voted to allow police to investigate All matters internally.

Instead of putting all cases, of police assualts against civilians or common law breaches, straight to the CPS, 

They now get a chance to cover up the matter or potentially 'falsify' the evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The current police complaints system, is currently full of potential:

1. Corruption.

2. Conflict of interest - of the investigators knowing the person or persons that they are investigating.

3. Power or knowledge to potentially contaminate the incidence.

4. Potential or knowledge of how to falsify the evidence and manipulate the witness's:

    A. By only asking the right question or by
    misleading the witness into saying the right 
    answer, to allow the true police criminal to walk.

attributes.action: Make polygamy a specific criminal offence
attributes.background: Bigamy is a criminal offence in the UK and it therefor makes no sense for polygamy not to be a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Briefing Paper number 05051 dated 6th January 2016.

attributes.action: Make an INDEPENDENT EU booklet - facts, figures, forecasts if we STAY + if we GO
attributes.background: The EU Referendum is producing a blizzard of numbers, claims, guesses - it is virtually impossible for voters to assess properly the facts as they stand, or to get a balanced set of forecasts on the implications of either result. Without this information, the public cannot be asked to make a choice.
attributes.additional_details:
An independently produced booklet, perhaps no bigger the governments already produced booklet on why we should vote to stay, can be quickly produced to present first the facts as they stand and then the general expert views on what are the implications for the country if we vote to stay and if we vote to go.
Without giving voters a proper opportunity to assess both the facts and the body of opinion for both options in order to make their informed choice, we undermine democracy itself.

attributes.action: stop means testing carers allowance
attributes.background: us carers work hard to support our friends and family with dissabilities and yet we get money deducted from esa child tax working tax if we claim carers this is wrong.its a small price the goverment pay to us and then they take it back from other means,its wrong!!!

attributes.action: Make vaping bans illegal and regulate vaping fluid ingredients.
attributes.background:
Vaping is much safer than smoking, and causes no unpleasant odour. If the ridiculous bans on vaping of many establishments was made illegal, many more smokers would make the switch.

Many vaping "pre-mix" fluids contain needless toxic ingredients for "a smoother vape" and should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is for the good of public health.

If vaping indoors was a legal right, more people would invest in electronic cigarettes out of convenience alone. More people would make the switch and save the NHS millions in the long term, while nicotine tax would continue to provide government revenue.

Poor quality vaping fluids are the reason why people think vaping is unsafe. Pre-mix vaping fluids need only contain nicotine, base and flavour, as is already available but it should be the law.

attributes.action: The Royal Marines Calendar should be allowed
attributes.background: Allow the Royal Marines to release thier annual calendar to raise money for essential charities. If the government cannot fund the charities the Royal Marines want to support, then allow them to raise the money by making a calendar!

attributes.action: Allow current/new students to have free text books for university courses
attributes.background: It is only fair that current/new students get the fulfilment of their university course they pay for (£9,000 a year), by providing free set text books for each course they are on.
attributes.additional_details: With the decision made by the Government for tuition fees to rise further to £9,250 in the academic year of 2017, it is plausible for Parliament to enforce this.

attributes.action: Nationalise the M6 Toll road
attributes.background: The M6 toll road is currently underused and is a resource that could be used more effectively under national ownership, this would help save time and money not only to businesses but to local and national economies and also help with air pollution experienced on the M6 which has heavy congestion.
attributes.additional_details:
Nationalising the M6 Toll would have numerous benefits from alleviating congestion on the M6 and surrounding roads to helping businesses and local economies of towns that are situated alongside the toll road such as Cannock which is currently having the Mill Green designer outlet village built. 
http://millgreenoutletvillage.co.uk/
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35553865
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2015/sep/17/leaving-tackling-air-pollution-to-local-authorities-is-an-inadequate-response

attributes.action: Make employers test for cannabis using the saliva test rather than urine.
attributes.background: The urine test for cannabis is thought to be able to detect cannabis taken from upto 2-3 months prior to the test. This is a massive issue as cannabis has no impairment on your work even a day later. The saliva test used by police for roadside testing only detects cannabis taken that day.
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is used worldwide as medication and although it could affect the way in which you work, the effects wear off after a few hours.

The test for alcohol in a work place can only detect alcohol taken that day or the day before therefore, the same should apply to cannabis.

Unemployment is already a massive issue in the UK and these tests only make it more difficult for people to maintain their employment wether they use recreationally or for medical purposes.

attributes.action: Raise the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel to £1,000.
attributes.background: The Press states that the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel will be doubled from £100 to £200.   For a car owner / driver this is ridiculously small.   I believe that the Government should raise the fine for such dangerous behaviour to at least £1,000.   Breaking this law should hurt!

attributes.action: The abuse of a redhead should be made a criminal offence as a form of racism.
attributes.background:
It's racial abuse and harrassment and works the same as being harassed for having a different colour skin or having a different god. 
It is an 'accepted' form of abuse in society which is wrong as this amount of bullying and mental abuse is dangerous for a person's insecurities or mental health.
attributes.additional_details: I am a strong believer in this being a form of racism and I will never believe it is okay for people to be tortured for being different. People get trauma treatment and counselling due to insecurities and mental illness triggered by the abuse and harassment. People can be rejected from work, friendships, relationships and school events for it. It can have a long lasting impact on those affected and even lead people to suicide.

attributes.action: Ban the release of Helium balloons
attributes.background:
Helium is a rare gas, which is becoming scarce, we allow people to release helium filled balloons for memorials/ celebrations / competitions. 
It causes major problems when the balloons deflate for wildlife and in particular aquatic animals. A number of whale deaths are recently attributed to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://balloonsblow.org/
http://www.nabas.co.uk/about-balloons/
http://www.abc.net.au/science/surfingscientist/heliumballoons.htm
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/how-balloon-releases-harm-wildlife/
http://www.mcsuk.org/downloads/pollution/dont%20let%20go.pdf

They are becoming part of the plastic soup we dump into out oceans killing wildlife we cannot continue like this, it a simple start please sign.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists using mobile phones whilst actively riding.
attributes.background: It has become evident, that there is an increasing number of cyclists on UK roads, pavements and cycle ways, utilising their mobile phones whilst actively riding. Not only are they putting themselves and pedestrians at risk, but the driver of road vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: If there were to be an accident involving a car and cyclist, the motorist would face consequences due to damage caused. There is an increasing call for drivers to be safer when it comes to cyclists, and the way in which they use the road (eg passing with enough space) but how do we guard against unsafe cyclists on their mobile devices, taking a call and/or sending a message. It is unsafe for a motorist and therefore unsafe for a cyclist.

attributes.action: Change the law on child sex offences .
attributes.background: I would like to create a petition to change the law in sentencing on child sex offences. The sentencing should reflect the offence and be minimum life sentencing.

attributes.action: Increased protection for beneficiaries under Mirror Wills following first death.
attributes.background: My father and stepmother prepared Mirror Wills whereby the estate first passed to the surviving spouse and then to my stepbrother and myself in equal shares.  After my father died my stepmother changed her Will and left everything to her own family.  I lost my family inheritance of approx £150,000
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the following changes. (1)  A  formal warning to be included in all Mirror Wills that your final wishes may not be respected should you die first.  (2) A new legal requirement than any beneficiary under a Mirror Will  subsequently disinherited must receive formal written notice for it to have effect.
My story has been featured in the National Press, television and radio and is included in the current  television series of the BBC production "Rip Off Britain"

attributes.action: Treat Halls of Residence as commercial premises for TV licence purposes
attributes.background: Halls of residence are little more than self catering Hotels or Hostels.  Students share "Flats" with on average 8 other students. Although they have their own room (as they do at home and don't need their own licence).Yet every student has to pay for their own licence! This is an unfair system.
attributes.additional_details: A 50 bedroom hostel would pay £145.50 for the first 15 units and £145.50 for every 5 units after that. So its total cost would be £1164.00 which divided by 50 people is only £23.28 each per year. However in a 50 room hall of residence each student has to pay £145.50 because their rooms include receiving equipment/sockets, whether they use them or not. The total cost raised for the BBC is £7275 (more if paid in installments) If students can't have free TV then at least make the system fair.

attributes.action: Make cycling in groups of over 6 a road traffic offence.
attributes.background: In the country side all weekend we are fed up of cyclists using our narrow lanes in large groups, this is incredibly dangerous to other road users, cars, horse riders, etc. They have very little regard or consideration for other people using the road.
attributes.additional_details: Getting very fed up of large groups of cyclists road racing with no stewards and no road closures with very little regard for other road users. If groups were limited to groups of 6 passing them down narrow lanes would be much safer for all.

attributes.action: A public holiday if Team GB finish above China in the medals team at Rio 2016
attributes.background:
If Team GB finish above China in the medals table, we should have a day's public holiday in the UK to celebrate this.

3rd place is the highest Team GB has ever finished an Olympic Games on foreign soil (1st in London 1908), so if we can beat the Chinese and finish second this would be crazy.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/rio-2016/medals/countries

336 GB athletes at Rio 2016 
412 Chinese athletes at Rio 2016

1.357 billion - population of China
64 million - population of UK

attributes.action: Ensure that every train has a guard.
attributes.background: It should be a condition of offering a franchise to a Train Operating Company that every train has a guard. This improves safety and service and is reassuring for the travelling public, especially the elderly, disabled, and passengers with young children.

attributes.action: Teach sea safety in all costal schools.
attributes.background: We should make it mandatory for all costal schools to teach their pupils about sea safety, as they do in Australia, this information has the potential to save many many lives and should be taught in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Many people each year find themselves stuck in rip tides, most of which in this country have no idea of what a rip tide is, never mind what to do if ever caught in one, there is plenty of life saving information out there and without this information the worst could happen. In Australia most if not all children in costal school are taught about the dangers of the sea and how they could potentially avoid it, we should take note from this and apply it to our own schools, potentially saving lives.

attributes.action: Benefit sanctions must be stopped without exception.
attributes.background: Benefit sanctions are being handed out unlawfully.

attributes.action: Eye specialist, Moorfields, should decide who is fit to drive not the DVLA.
attributes.background: An Easterman eye test is not as conclusive as the DVLA believe. Some people cannot pass one but are still considered fit to drive but the DVLA will not listen to the specialists. Organisations like Moorfields should be able to say who is fit to drive. They are the professionals.

attributes.action: Commence an urgent review of the Child Maintenance Service Policies/Procedures.
attributes.background: The service levels offered by the Child Maintenance Service are exceptionally poor, staff are unhelpful and do not carry out instructions within reasonable timescales.  Also, the use of Gross Income in the calculations is unfair and takes no account of paying parents financial circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered from numerous issues created by this agency and am being financially disadvantaged by them and I am sure I am not alone.  Whilst the majority of paying parents have no issue paying maintenance, it is unfair and unjust that payments do not take into account the financial circumstances of either the paying or the receiving parent.

attributes.action: Improved education on Keeping Britain Tidy and stricter penalties for litterers
attributes.background: Our hedgerows, dykes, residential areas, countryside, roadsides, beaches and rivers, to name some, are strewn with litter and an absolute disgrace to our nation. Sadly some members of society have no shame in dropping their rubbish, thus believing it to be another's responsibility to clean up.

attributes.action: Stop Housing Associations charging more than social rent on their properties.
attributes.background: My 20 years old has a 1 bedroom Circle 33 Housing Association property and her rent in £189.00 per week.  Another Circle property 2 minutes away is £129.00 p/w. She is under so much stress and anxiety worrying about getting work and paying her rent and not ending up homeless.
attributes.additional_details: She will have to claim a portion of Housing Benefit as she will not be in a position to pay it all herself.  Surely if the rent was lowered there would be smaller claims for Housing Benefit, possibly no claims at all in some circumstances being made. Surely it is common sense to reduce the rent to reduce the amount of Housing Benefit claims being made.  There is nothing included the £189.00 rent, e.g. water rates or care taking facilities.

attributes.action: Make it law for individuals to return footballs if they land on their property
attributes.background: 1000's of footballs are held hostage each year by individuals who assume rights to the ball once it lands on their property. As parents of a very keen footballer, this has cost us a small fortune over the years and we would like to ask government to address this very hazy and unclear subject.

attributes.action: Road works on motorways should require 24/7 working.
attributes.background: Road works on motorways and major public roads should have 24/7 working to reduce loss of trade to local business and increased inconvenience to the UK population. The UK will be globally more effective and prosperous if the UK's transport links are more efficient.
attributes.additional_details: A short term pain, will lead to a long term gain.

attributes.action: Have a new runway at both Gatwick and Heathrow
attributes.background: If this Government decides on one or other it won't be long before we'll have the whole debate again. Having spare capacity at both airports will be an operational relief and set us up for the next decades.

attributes.action: Compel Bacs to process payments over a maximum 1-day execution time
attributes.background: In 2007 the EU declared rapid payments essential for a modern and properly functioning economy, adding that there is no reason why payments should not be made by the end of the next business day at the latest. Why, then, nine years later, does Bacs still take three days to process payments?
attributes.additional_details: In 2016, 3-day payments should be redundant. For an electronic payment to take 3 days to process is unacceptable. A cheque which clears on the fourth day is barely any slower. And yet, Bacs is the only option for direct debits, the only RTI-enabled option for payroll payments, and the entrenched option for all other payments. There was no reason in 2007, and there remains no reason today, why all these payments should not be processed over a maximum 1-day execution time, by default.

attributes.action: Protect the original terms of students loans in statutory law
attributes.background: Students plan their financial future according to the terms of student loans.  The fragility of these terms was exposed by the recent freeze of the repayment threshold.  Prevent current and future governments betraying the trust of students with statutory protection of student loan terms.
attributes.additional_details: Student loans as of 2011/12 were based on a number of terms, including 9% rate of pay back over earning threshold of £21k, write-off of debt after 30 years. None of these terms are safeguarded in law meaning government can retrospectively change the terms of the loan, as evidenced to the recent freeze of earning threshold (see Alex True's petition). Imagine what an increase in the pay back rate would mean for your or your child's future. Google Sutton Trust's "Unfair deal" report.

attributes.action: Review the way the Department of Work and Pensions treats mentally ill claimants
attributes.background: I am doing this on behalf of a friend who has suffered with long term depression and has been treated appallingly by the DWP. I am concerned that this is not a one-off case and that there are a lot of vulnerable people who are being treated in such an irresponsible and dangerous manner.

attributes.action: Introduce PR to resolve the deep divisions created by the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Self-explanatory
attributes.additional_details: The referendum demanded a single answer to a complex question, was unbalanced in terms of outcome (one being final) and was decided by a narrow margin.

attributes.action: To scrap Grades 1 - 9 and go back to A - U grading/marking.
attributes.background: There is no standardised system or coherent system that any one school can take and use. The system is failing children as schools are unsure how to use the new marking system so the children suffer. This petition is highlighting the need to revert back to simple but effective A - U marking.
attributes.additional_details: As teachers we have a duty of care towards our children and if we are unable to mark correctly, the Department for Education is setting schools and children up to fail. We have not seen any good positive need for this marking system and we are now angry at having to use it over and above a perfectly good marking system used for many years prior. Children’s minds should not be bogged down with a complicated marking system. Go back to A - U, keep it simple and teaching improves.

attributes.action: Ban Air Guns
attributes.background: After a ricochet I was shot in the eye with an air pistol over 50 years ago and still being treated for the after effects, it has left me with partial sight that causes problems to this day.

attributes.action: Protect the public sector from future Private Finance Initiatives (PFI)
attributes.background: PFI’s charge on average 15% interest pa for 30 years. We propose that all future public sector infrastructure projects should be paid for through Public Finance Initiative Bonds (PFIB’s) where members of the general public could invest via the post office into PFIB’s in return for a 5% interest p.a.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is currently paying £3,729 every minute to private companies as part of an annual repayment fee for building and operating new hospitals or redeveloping old ones.
PFIBs could replace PFIs and be similar to National savings bonds where the general public deposit money (say a minimum £1,000 for a minimum of 5 years) via the post office into a PFIB this would be used to build future public infrastructure projects. Even allowing for 5% operating costs this would reduce our costs by over 25%

attributes.action: teachers to get a comparable fine to parents should they strike in term time
attributes.background: If parents taking children out of school during term for holidays damages children's education then the mass shut down of the schooling system must be worse, so the fines would be even between anyone stopping the education of our children including teachers

attributes.action: NO guarantee for EU nationals in UK without equality for Brits in EU.
attributes.background: Brits were encouraged for 30 years to invest in EU by buying houses for their retirement in a favourable climate for their health. Is it the wish of the British people for over a million UK pensioners to lose everything they have worked for all their lives?

attributes.action: Promise to match EU spending within the UK in the event of Brexit.
attributes.background: A large part of the campaign to leave the EU was based on the fact that the UK is a net contributor to the EU funds. We contribute £12.9bn a year (gross) or £7.1bn a year (net). In the event of Brexit, we would ask the government to maintain the level of investment in the UK that the EU contributed.
attributes.additional_details: The EU contributed £5.2bn a year to the UK, by various mechanisms. Given that in the event of Britain leaving the EU we will not be paying membership fees, we would ask that the government promise to maintain the payments that would have been made by the EU. This will, for example, protect vulnerable areas of the UK by matching the funding they would have received from the European development fund.

attributes.action: Make MP's like us: 93% state school; 50% women; 100% from their constituency.
attributes.background: The country is economically and politically divided. MP's are bewildered by those outside London because they are so different from them. Let's break the domination of private school educated, London based men in our politics. Bring in quotas now for our representatives so MP's look like us.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of the population are women. Women got the vote a hundred years ago and still they are under represented and under paid in every walk of life.
7% of the population are private school educated and yet they make up to 50% of MP's in government. 
Career politicians live and work in London and do not understand the people they represent. 
These three problems can be solved by the next General Election. Let's make MP's more like us and bring in quotas for a fairer, less divided, United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Potential employers must contact the applicant whether they're accepted or not
attributes.background: I've applied to jobs and although I have one currently, too many people will apply to jobs and receive no no input from the potential employer. To be forced to wait 2 weeks for a job you might not get, to be told you haven't got it after that waiting period is needed.
